newsitem.title: USA: Fed seen adding reserves via four-day system RPs.
newsitem.headline: Fed seen adding reserves via four-day system RPs.

text.p: The Federal Reserve is expected to add reserves to the banking system on Thursday through four-day fixed system repurchase agreements, analysts and Fed watchers said.
"We expect a four-day fixed system RP," said an economist at Stone and McCarthy Research Associates Inc.
Analysts at MMS International Inc also said they expect the Fed to add reserves via four-day system RPs.
At 1000 EDT/1400 GMT federal funds were quoted at 5-3/16 percent, below the central bank's 5-1/4 percent target.
